sentences.sentence: This small town called Privonoj in the south of Russia, some 1,200 kilometres from Moscow, is not known to many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But its school once taught one of the country's most renowned figures, Mikhail Gorbachev, the last Soviet leader who passed away on Tuesday at the age of 91.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: After some time in the ninth grade at school, he was awarded an order for participating in the harvest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He was a perky, smart, well-read and active guy. He played an active role in our school. He took part in artistic performances and he was also the secretary of the all-union Leninist Young Communist League organisation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Gorbachev eventually left Privolnoye, which is home to around 3,000 souls, to study in Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But he later returned and became the region's Communist Party committee chairman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And over the years, he didn't forget the town.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The head of the village before me also addressed him and before that too. We built a church and had problem with the domes. He helped." Gorbachev came from humble beginnings. His parents were farm laborers who worked in the Privolnoi's wheat fields. His mother and father were both buried in the town.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The modest home where Gorbachev spent his childhood no longer exists, but his parents' last home is still standing in the small town.
